column4: So. Do you have any idea why my USB port would do that? It was working just fine before I upgraded.
if you run lsusb , does it show ?
It shows 5. I have three USB ports, a card slot, and A CF slot. Do you think the other two are those?
It shows five.
can you paste the output in pastebin
k
http://pastebin.com/VZhLBYeQ
that looks very normal , perhaps your mouse only works with USB2.0 , the others appear to be the older USB version 1.1
No
The mouse works with all USB ports
In fact I usually plug it into that port
my mouse is just a standard Dell wired mouse. You know, the old indestructable kind that's the same as a PS2 mouse except it's usb
And if that was the case, how come my USB storage devices and keyboard don't work in that port either?
are all the other usb ports occupied , if not try eqach one
all of the other ones work
the only thing I can think of is, that one USB port has lost power from the power supply connection , you'll just have to use one of the others
Umm
No. It still has power to it.
did you try a stick or something on it ?
I plugged an external fan into it.
